definition: incorruptible/honest/inexpensive/to investigate (old)/side wall of a traditional Chinese house (old)

sentences.english: Do you think this year's District Council Election was corruption-free?
sentences.chinese: 你认为今届区议会选举系唔系廉洁咁进行？

sentences.english: How did F.D.R. manage to make big government so clean?
sentences.chinese: 罗斯福如何让大政府如此廉洁？

sentences.english: In 2011 his work "Honest Election" wins the honorable mention.
sentences.chinese: 2011年创作的《廉洁选举》公益广告获得优秀奖。

sentences.english: He is generally counted as incorruptible good official of the law.
sentences.chinese: 人们普遍认为他是一个廉洁的好法官。

sentences.english: "Incorruptibility and cleanness are the lifelines of the Red Cross' work in China," Hua said.
sentences.chinese: “清正廉洁是中国红十字会工作的准则，”华建敏说。

sentences.english: The Republicans made a great whoop and a hollar about the honesty of federal employees.
sentences.chinese: 共和党人在联邦政府官员的廉洁问题上大做文章。

sentences.english: According to the document, Hunan Province will improve the integrity of project construction team and take it as a prerequisite for projects bidding.
sentences.chinese: 《意见》规定，我省将实行项目建设队伍廉洁准入制。

sentences.english: It emphasizes the need for clean governments prepared to tackle these issues.
sentences.chinese: 报告强调需要建立廉洁的政府来着手解决这些问题。

sentences.english: Few people behave disinterestedly in life .
sentences.chinese: 生活中很少有人能表现得廉洁无私。

sentences.english: In Chinese history, there are many honest and dedicated people.
sentences.chinese: 在中国历史上，有很多廉洁奉公的人。

sentences.english: It is no secret that Singapore owes it all to its uncorrupt leaders for where it is today.
sentences.chinese: 众所周知，新加坡的成功得归功于我们廉洁的领导人。

sentences.english: He is seen as the mirror of honesty and uprightness.
sentences.chinese: 他被视为清正廉洁的典范。

sentences.english: A man of integrity and incorruptibility is proof against bribery.
sentences.chinese: 正直廉洁的人不为金钱所收买。

sentences.english: And the cultural cause and industry, which have been ap- plied to carry and support the honest notion, have been stably developed.
sentences.chinese: 承载和支持廉洁理念的文化事业与文化产业稳步发展。

definition: self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
Aimin district of Mudanjiang city 牡丹江市, Heilongjiang
to be strict with oneself (idiom)/to demand a lot of oneself
to fight corruption and advocate probity
to appoint people according to their merits (idiom); appointment on the basis of ability and integrity
